abstract: Google introduced a marketplace of business software to help to spur the adoption of its own suite of productivity applications.
snippet: Google introduced a marketplace of business software to help to spur the adoption of its own suite of productivity applications.
lead_paragraph: Google on Tuesday introduced an online store for business applications in an effort to further push its own suite of productivity software into companies and to compete with Microsoft.

headline.main: Google Opens App Store for Business Software

abstract: While Google, Wal-Mart and other corporations have embraced fuel cells, California regulators have turned down requests from the state’s two biggest utilities to install the technology.
snippet: While Google, Wal-Mart and other corporations have embraced fuel cells, California regulators have turned down requests from the state’s two biggest utilities to install the technology.
lead_paragraph: While Google, Wal-Mart and other corporations have embraced fuel cells, California regulators have turned down requests from the state’s two biggest utilities to install the technology.

headline.main: California Utility Regulators Not Quite Ready for Fuel Cells

abstract: Our daily roundup of technology tidbits features Google’s new service to show you what the Web is reading, the employment boom for hackers and a couple of trips down memory lane.
snippet: Our daily roundup of technology tidbits features Google’s new service to show you what the Web is reading, the employment boom for hackers and a couple of trips down memory lane.
lead_paragraph: Wednesday’s roundup of flotsam and jetsam from around the Web, as selected by the technology reporters and editors of The New York Times. (And if you don’t like what we’ve picked out, see the first item for a link to Google’s new service along these lines.)

headline.main: What We’re Reading: What You’re Reading
